page.title: 14BUTTERFLIES OF STUBHAMPTON
page.content: Altogether 37 species of butterfly have been recorded since 1975 but only 30 still have breeding colonies. Downland species:-The Chalk Blue,once common is now rare;but many Brown Argus,Dingy skipper,Marbled White, Small Heath,Small Skipper and Common Blue still suvive.The Large Skipper and Green Hairstreak are still numerous,as is the Grizzled Skipper. Coppiced Woodland Species:-Of the Fritillary butterflies only the Silver Washed Fritillary retains good numbers.The Small Pearl Bordered Fritillary has now vanished and the Dark Green and Pearl Bordered are reduced in numbers.The Duke of Burgundy survives in very small numbers. Mature Woodland Species:-The White Admiral and Purple Hairstreaks maintain small colonies.The Ringlet and speckled Wood flourish.
